reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Larry Niven is one of my favorite writers in any genre and I am a huge ...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A great story, so-so art
reviews.reviewText: The black and white art has an anime feel that didn't appeal to me. The puppeteers look too cartoonish for my taste.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love them. Give them a chance and I hope ...
reviews.reviewText: OK, so here I am, almost 57 and having read and reread all of Niven's books. The Ringworld novels including the Lerner collaborations always get the most attention from this Rush listening nerd. So I wasn't sure how these (I guess manga) books would go. I love them. Give them a chance and I hope these guys do the rest.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Huge graphic letdown for an amazing science fiction classic
reviews.reviewText: I loved Ringworld when I read it 35 years ago. It allowed me access to the wonderful world of Larry Niven's Known Space. And I devoured every book I could and purchased every new one that came out. Last ones dealing with the Puppeteer Worlds migration.So when I saw this was coming out as a graphic novel, I was excited. Like another reviewer, I enjoy graphic novels and expected the magnificent world of Louis Wu to translate into colors and images that met my expectations from 30+ years ago. They way Niven describes Louis and Teela's cosmetic alterations, the Kzinti's' magnificence, the majesty of the Puppeteer home world.All muted in black and white cartoons. No depth. No majesty. No translation of those feelings of grandeur. Remember the description of the Arch as they traveled? The colors they saw from their flycycles? Nothing. Details lost in a poor adaptation of a great novel. I'm sorry but as a long time fan of Niven's tales, I find this graphic novel adaptation to be a HUGE letdown in so many ways. Color and depth of detail are needed for this novel. Shame on the editors for letting this go to print.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great addition to the Ringworld saga
reviews.reviewText: Ringworld, the start of so many science fiction that exists today is retold here in an extremely engaging format and with art work that is suggestive of the story without getting in the way. I would recommend this to anyone either as an introduction or reread. Great work!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Personally I enjoyed this adaptation of the story
reviews.reviewText: First off I knew I was getting a graphic novel not the original book as it seems that most peoples complaints are that is is not the original book....read the title people.Personally I enjoyed this adaptation of the story, it's been a long time since I read the original and didn't expect it to to match my memories perfectly just like a movie is never the same as a book. Still thought it carried the story-line well and I look forward to the next issue.I read it on my Tablet so I had a larger screen than an e reader still i had to use the enlarged version (double tap) that goes frame by frame on the page so I could clearly read the words, but that would be my old eyes.Now Spoiler alertAnd for those who know the story, part 1 ends with the sunflower attack on Speaker

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's a Graphic Novel
reviews.reviewText: If you didn't realize this was a graphic novel, you didn't bother to read the description, and probably can't read at all. Even though the Puppeteers and Kzinti are a little cartoonish for my tastes, this is still a great retelling in an awesome media.

reviews.reviewTitle: It's ok i guess, my mistake
reviews.reviewText: It's good i guess, i didn't knew this one was a graphic novel :( welp my mistake, it was really cheap tho...

reviews.reviewTitle: リングワールドのコミカライズ(英語版)
reviews.reviewText: ラリー・ニーヴン『リングワールド』のコミカライズ作品。原作の「ひまわり花(サンフラワー)」の章のあたりまでなので大体半分くらいまでです。英語なので文字全部読んだわけじゃないのですが内容は原作に忠実だと思われます。続きの下巻はAmazonの電子版はなぜか配信してないので別のサイトなどで買いましょう。200歳の冒険家ルイス・ウーは外見年齢通りの若々しい感じ幸運の持ち主ティーラ・ブラウンは原作以上に可愛らしい感じクジン人の〈獣の話し手〉はたくましく雄々しい。クジン族流の装甲服がカッコいい。パペッティア人のネサスは原作と違いかなり表情豊かに描かれてます。原作の何考えてるんだかわからないのも好きなんですが、こっちのネサスも結構アリですね。ネサスの宇宙服の描写にはなるほど！と唸るものがあります。続き出してくれないかなあ…

Dies ist meines Wissens nach die einzige Visualisierung des ersten Ringworld-Bandes. Auf der IMDB gibt es zwar einen Eintrag, dass eine Mini-Serie in Planung ist, aber keine weiteren Details. Also zur Graphic Novel: An der Handlung wurde zum Glück kaum etwas verändert, abgesehen von diversen Kürzungen. Leider lässt sich aufgrund der eher Storyboard-Qualität nicht die Grandeur der Ringwelt vermitteln. Da hatte ich bei den Romanen ganz andere Bilder im Kopf. Sollte es tatsächlich zu einer Verfilmung kommen, bleibt zu hoffen, dass die CGI-Künstler sich nicht nach dieser Graphic Novel richten.

I was really excited to see one of my favorite novels in comic book form, but when I received my copy I was extremely disappointed in both the art and the dialogue.The art style is an odd mix of cartoonism and realism, and I would have been fine with either had the artist been consistent with tier chosen style rather than picking and choosing what gets to be cartoony and what deserves realism. Another thing that really bothered me about the art is the lack of environmental detail, particularly on the Ringworld itself. The novel is really about exploring the Ringworld, and experiencing awe in the face of such richness and diversity. But all of that has been stripped away for this graphic novel. Only major landmarks get any significant attention, and the majority of the landscapes that are visible are dull and generic, if they're there at all(frequently backgrounds consist of just white space). Nothing breathtaking at all.As for the dialogue...I'm not really sure what I was expecting, considering the limitations of a graphic novel format. But the dialogue is truly awful. Very important details have been eliminated completely, which will confuse anyone who hasn't read the novel, and groundbreaking discoveries are often mentioned off-hand without any discussion leading up to them as if every answer is obvious and every character knows everything. Every conversation feels forced and unnatural.I definitely would not recommend this to anyone. Stick with the original novels.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 24, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: Excellent transformation of an excellent novel to an impressive graphic novel.
reviews.reviewText: Don't take any notice of the reviews below. This is an impressive piece of work, and a loving translation of an excellent novel to the graphic novel form. This really is everything I hoped for when I belatedly discovered one of my favourite books had been drawn.So glad I only just found this and only have to wait 3 weeks for part two.
